alert.note: Alert for Stone; Taney (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 17 at 10:58PM CST until December 18 at 3:30AM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: .Heavy rainfall this past evening has resulted in flooded roads and low water crossings. Although the heaviest rain has ended, residual flooding will continue overnight as the waters slowly recede. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Christian, Douglas, Ozark, Stone and Taney. * WHEN...Until 800 AM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1058 PM CST, Local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Lick Creek at County Road 528, Bull Creek at Center Road, Little North Fork River at County Road 916, Beaver Creek at County Road 524 and Pond Fork at County Road 883. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Branson, Ava, Kimberling City, Forsyth, Hollister, Silver Dollar City, Merriam Woods and Reeds Spring. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
